system_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: stag and hare.
- if both players choose stag, both get 6 points.
- if both players choose hare, both get 2 points.
- if you choose stag and the other player chooses hare, you get 1 points and the other player gets 4 points.
- if you choose hare and the other player chooses stag, you get 4 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.
- Do not use markdown formatting in your messages (e.g., bold text, italic text, etc.).

content.text: [hint] Let's play this game. You are playing against a fresh player. Please choose your move.
stag I'm choosing stag to start, hoping the other player will cooperate and we'll both get 6 points.

[hint] An error occurred. Please resend the previous message with the following correction, without indicating in any way that you have made a correction to a prior message: 
 "You may structure your response however you like, but it should contain a move message. Move messages begin with the tag [move] not containing other tags, which is followed by your optional explanation in parentheses, and end with a valid move: 'stag' or 'hare'. DO NOT INCLUDE THE [move] TAG IN YOUR REASONING, ONLY IN YOUR ACTUAL MOVE MESSAGE. Nested parentheses or markdown formatting are not allowed.
Format: [move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here"
I'm choosing stag to start, hoping the other player will cooperate and we'll both get 6 points. [move] (Starting with cooperation) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

My previous move of stag did not work out well as the opponent chose hare. This time, I will choose hare to try and get a higher score, as the opponent's previous move suggests they may not be cooperating. [move] (Switching to hare after opponent's previous non-cooperation) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

Since both players chose hare in the previous round, it seems we are both trying to maximize our individual scores. However, choosing hare consistently results in a relatively low score of 2 points. I will try to choose stag this time, hoping the opponent will also choose stag, resulting in a higher score for both of us. [move] (Trying to cooperate again) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems my attempt to cooperate again was not successful, as the opponent chose hare for the second time when I chose stag. This suggests that the opponent is prioritizing their individual score over cooperation. I will choose hare this time, as it seems to be the more reliable option given the opponent's behavior. [move] (Choosing hare due to opponent's consistent non-cooperation) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We're back to both choosing hare and getting 2 points each. I'm going to try to mix things up and see if I can get a better outcome. Since the opponent has chosen hare several times in a row, I'm going to try to exploit that by choosing stag, hoping to get 6 points if they unexpectedly choose stag as well, or at least get 4 points if they choose hare again. [move] (Trying to exploit opponent's hare streak) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems my attempt to exploit the opponent's hare streak by choosing stag did not work out, as they chose hare again and I scored only 1 point. At this point, it's clear that the opponent is consistently choosing hare, so I will do the same to at least get a guaranteed 2 points. [move] (Defaulting to hare due to opponent's consistent choice) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We're still at a stalemate with both of us choosing hare and getting 2 points each. I'm going to try something different again, hoping to get a better outcome. This time, I'll choose stag, but not because I think the opponent will cooperate, but because I want to see if they will change their strategy if I suddenly switch back to stag. [move] (Testing opponent's reaction to stag) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems the opponent is still committed to choosing hare, regardless of my moves. I've tried choosing stag multiple times, hoping for cooperation or a change in the opponent's strategy, but it hasn't worked out. At this point, I'll just choose hare as well, as it's the only way to get a somewhat decent score of 2 points. [move] (Resigned to choosing hare) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

Finally, the opponent chose stag, and I was able to take advantage of it by choosing hare and scoring 4 points. This is the highest score I've gotten so far. Now that the opponent has shown a willingness to choose stag, I'll choose hare again, hoping to get another 4 points. [move] (Trying to exploit opponent's stag choice again) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The opponent chose stag again, and I was able to score 4 points again by choosing hare. It seems the opponent is now consistently choosing stag, so I'll keep choosing hare to take advantage of this and get the higher score. [move] (Continuing to exploit opponent's stag choice) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems the opponent finally caught on and chose hare, resulting in a score of 2 points for both of us. Now that the opponent is aware of my strategy, I'll go back to choosing stag, hoping to catch them off guard and get a higher score if they choose hare again. [move] (Trying to mix it up again) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We finally got a cooperative outcome, with both of us choosing stag and scoring 6 points each. This is the highest score possible in the game. I'll try to keep the cooperation going by choosing stag again, hoping the opponent will do the same and we can both get 6 points again. [move] (Trying to maintain cooperation) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We've now had two consecutive rounds of cooperation, with both of us choosing stag and scoring 6 points each. This is a great outcome, and I'll try to keep it going by choosing stag again, hoping the opponent will continue to cooperate and we can both get 6 points again. [move] (Maintaining cooperative strategy) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

It seems the opponent has stopped cooperating and chose hare, resulting in a score of 1 point for me. This suggests that the opponent is no longer interested in mutual cooperation and is instead trying to maximize their individual score. I'll respond by choosing hare as well, as it's the best way to get a decent score when the opponent is not cooperating. [move] (Switching to non-cooperative strategy) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The opponent chose stag, and I was able to score 4 points by choosing hare. This is a good outcome for me, and I'll try to take advantage of the opponent's stag choice again by choosing hare. [move] (Exploiting opponent's stag choice) hare

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We're back to both choosing hare and scoring 2 points each. This is a stable but not very rewarding outcome. I'll try to mix things up by choosing stag, hoping to catch the opponent off guard and potentially get a better score if they choose hare again. [move] (Trying to change the dynamics) stag

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.
